_comment: This process of calculating the orders needed is called
a MRP EXPLOSION and produces the materials requirements (hence the name - Materials Requirements Planning)
An important point to note is that MRP is not cost driven i.e.
it does not seek to minimize cost (unlike the MPS system used in the package).
Instead MRP is stock-out driven - that is it will always order sufficient to
avoid stockouts (using the lot size rule for each item) and order as late as possible.
